ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] I'm back ;)
ygData.msgSnippet: it seems to me that if they can read the process list and they know which process are hack programs, then they should write some simple code that will cause
ygData.messageBody:
it seems to me that if they can read the process list and they "know" which
process are hack programs, then they should write some simple code that will
cause the client to crash and write a line to a log file explaining why the
client was forced to terminate. Then, next time you tried to log on, they
could read that log file and ban you. There should be no need for them to
upload anything that doesn't have to do with their game.

Draelon

-----Original Message-----
From: Kimes, Dean W. [mailto:dean_kimes@...]
Sent: Thursday, April 06, 2000 4:41 PM
To: 'eqbards@egroups.com'
Subject: RE: [eqbards] I'm back ;)


That's pretty funny. I'm not cheating either but I definitely have
proprietary info from work (I work at an investment company bound by SEC
regs) that would be a big problem if someone at Verant even accidentally
looked at it. Some of it does reside in the temp internet directories since
I debug web apps.

Kit

-----Original Message-----
From: Perhaps a Princess... [mailto:sarah@...]
Sent: Thursday, April 06, 2000 2:43 PM
To: eqbards@egroups.com
Subject: RE: [eqbards] I'm back ;)


>-----Original Message-----
>From: Gary Johnston [mailto:garyj@...]
>Sent: Thursday, April 06, 2000 7:35 AM

>how much do you wanna bet they think they have found other ways to stop
>hacking :)
>
>At a glance I'd say 2550 people will have their accounts looked at ;)

*smile* They can feel free to look at my account. I don't
care. I'm not cheating. But that doesn't mean I want them
snooping all over my computer either.
